text: I'll add myself to this, I had also noticed this and was one of the small reasons I had reverted back to HubL. It would be good to have these packaged into only 1 script or something of the sort :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi Timothy, thanks for your answer. Actually in prod I see no issues anymore (I am sure it was there before as well).
The problem in my case persists on localhost, not a huge probably but nice to have no duplication maybe? :slightly_smiling_face:
Do you know / have a plan to handle the dev-server duplication as well?

>  Do you know / have a plan to handle the dev-server duplication as well?
At the moment, no. It certainly would be nice to make dev more indicative of the prod environment. But I know of several of the tradeoffs Vite chooses (in terms of local development speed and flexibility) make this harder. And looking deeper into current Vite issues, I see <https://github.com/vitejs/vite/pull/16018> … and that looks like it would solve this issue :crossed_fingers:
Great, thanks for following up on this :slightly_smiling_face:

Hello there, i had a query regarding user behaviour/actions tracking in cms-react. can we use HubSpot native tracking as we are building an e-commerce app or we have to use some specific libraries to achive that. found this while searching <https://www.npmjs.com/package/react-HubSpot-tracking-code-hook>

We’ve pushed a fix for secrets not correctly making it through to the build. And verified that a `NPM_TOKEN` will successfully auth with <http://npmjs.com|npmjs.com> and find a private package. So as along as your `NPM_TOKEN` or `NPM_RC` secrets are <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C04AY1H2204/p1708109952987269?thread_ts=1708108558.041179&cid=C04AY1H2204|correctly set> things should work again.

Apologies for this, it definitely was a bug on our side. Thanks for the heads up and pressure!
If you are building on the HubSpot CMS, all the native tracking that exists today for "traditional HubL development" will continue to work with CMS React.

Hello, I am using the <Table /> component in a custom card. I would like 10 rows to appear in the table and for there to be pagination.
In the <CrmAssociationTable /> component there is the pageSize property that serves to limit the number of rows that appear in the table but not in the <Table/> component. Does anyone know how to do this? Thanks in advance
I've foun what the issue was, the crm_assocation function spits out different results on previee and on live, really wierd

Ahh gotcha, yes if there is an issue resolving the hublDataTemplate, no data will be passed

Might be worth asking HubL development team whether what you found is a bug or not
i was able to successfully deploy - thank you!
